title: NFT collapse, inflation 'pain,' and Serena's next play. Welcome to 'Nightcap'
description: CNN's Allison Morrow breaks down the Fed chair's blunt warning on inflation. Plus a crypto critic weighs in on the collapse of NFT prices. And USA Today sports columnist Christine Brennan joins 'Nightcap' host Jon Sarlin on what's ahead for Serena Williams. To get the day's business headlines sent directly to your inbox, sign up for the Nightcap newsletter.

title: Here's what might drive up the prices on the newest iPhones
description: With Apple widely expected to unveil the new iPhone 14 lineup at its upcoming event next Wednesday, a big question mark still surrounds how much, in this economy, the tech giant will charge for its latest-and-greatest smartphones.

title: Mortgage rates rise after Fed says it will take 'forceful' steps to curb inflation
description: Mortgage rates continued to climb this week following comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that the central bank is taking "forceful and rapid" steps to reduce inflation and slow the economy.

title: Poland puts its World War II losses at $1.3 trillion, demands German reparations
description: Poland estimates its World War II losses caused by Germany at 6.2 trillion zlotys ($1.32 trillion), the leader of the country's ruling nationalists said on Thursday, and he said Warsaw would officially demand reparations.

title: Opinion: US companies are committing to hiring refugees. More should follow suit
description: One year ago, the world collapsed for Sayed Kabir Kamall, an Afghan of Uzbek heritage. Kabir had worked in procurement for the US embassy in Afghanistan and, in his spare time, was a popular musician, recording music in support of the Afghan military. But by August 15, Kabul fell, and the next day, Kabir gathered his wife and their two children to make a desperate dash for the US-controlled airport.

title: 41% of Black and minority workers in the UK are suffering racism on the job
description: More than two in five Black, brown and minority ethnic workers in the United Kingdom say they have faced racism on the job, according to a new study.

title: Saudi Arabia seizes record 47 million amphetamine pills hidden in flour shipment
description: Authorities in Saudi Arabia have confiscated 47 million amphetamine pills which were hidden in a flour shipment, in an operation described as the biggest one-time drug smuggling attempt in terms of narcotics seized.

title: Gibraltar races to stop oil leak from beached cargo ship after collision with gas tanker
description: A cargo ship that collided with a natural gas tanker earlier this week off Gibraltar has "crumpled" and was leaking oil Thursday, according to authorities who said efforts were underway to salvage the vessel.

title: This UK company will hand out free food to 88,000 workers this winter
description: A leading British retailer plans to feed 88,000 workers over the winter to help them cope with the surging cost of living.

title: Strikes sweep Britain as soaring inflation savages living standards
description: Workers in the United Kingdom have had enough of falling living standards.

title: Major economies accused of 'backsliding' on emissions as G20 climate meet ends in failure
description: Some of the world's major economies are "backsliding" on their emissions commitments, the UK's climate delegate Alok Sharma said on Thursday, a day after a meeting of the Group of 20 (G20) nations failed to adopt a joint communiqué at climate talks.

Why a license plate spat has sparked ethnic tensions again in northern Kosovo
description: Kosovo will begin on Thursday a two-month implementation period for a controversial move to oblige Serbs, mainly those living in the northern part of the Balkan nation, bordering Serbia, to start using license plates issued by the government in Pristina.

title: Taiwan shoots down unidentified drone over island near China
description: Taiwan says it has shot down an unidentified civilian drone over one of its  islands that lies just a few kilometers from mainland China.

title: China may have committed 'crimes against humanity' in Xinjiang, UN report finds
description: China has committed "serious human rights violations" against Uyghur Muslims in its northwestern region of Xinjiang, which may amount to "crimes against humanity" according to a long-awaited report released Wednesday by the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights.

title: How green is your Pinterest-perfect plant collection?
description: From lush, temperamental fiddle-leaf figs to laidback snake plants, indoor houseplants have become ubiquitous in the homes of many millennials and Gen Z -- particularly as their care became a soothing and serotonin-boosting hobby early in the pandemic.

title: Malaysian court finds former first lady Rosmah guilty of bribery
description: A Malaysian court on Thursday found Rosmah Mansor, the wife of former prime minister Najib Razak, guilty of seeking and receiving bribes in exchange for government contracts, just days after her husband was jailed for corruption.

title: China records fewest marriages since 1986, adding to fears of population crisis
description: China last year registered the fewest marriages since its public records began more than three decades ago -- adding to concerns the country faces a looming demographic crisis.

title: Dazzling pink diamond could fetch more than $21 million at auction
description: A dazzling pink diamond, described as one of the world's purest, could fetch more than $21 million when it goes under the hammer in Hong Kong in October, auction house Sotheby's said on Wednesday.

title: India's August monsoon rains 3.4% above average, weather department says
description: India received 3.4% more rainfall than average in August as heavy rains hit central and southern parts of the country, the state-run weather office said on Wednesday.

title: US war-gamed with Ukraine ahead of counteroffensive
description: In the buildup to the current Ukrainian counteroffensive, the US urged Kyiv to keep the operation limited in both its objectives and its geography to avoid getting overextended and bogged down on multiple fronts, multiple US and western officials and Ukrainian sources tell CNN.

title: Analysis: China still needs Wall Street. A rare agreement with the US is proof
description: A new deal between the United States and China aims to draw a line under one of the biggest disputes in global business: how Chinese companies listed on Wall Street should be audited.
